conclusion: Need to calculate the change in magnetic flux through the coil as it rotates around the z-axis.
Magnetic flux is given by the product of the area of the coil and the magnetic induction intensity.
Identify the given values: Area of the coil ABCO = 0.4 m², Magnetic induction intensity B = 0.1 T.
Calculate the magnetic flux phi using the formula: phi = B x Area = 0.1 x 0.4 = 0.04 Weber.
Since the coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis, the area of the coil changes by 60°. The change in magnetic flux is proportional to the change in area.
Calculate the change in area: Delta Area = 60° x 0.4 m² = 24 m².
Calculate the change in magnetic flux: Delta phi = Delta Area x B = 24 x 0.1 = 2.4 Weber.
Since the magnetic flux is a scalar quantity, the change in magnetic flux is the same as the initial flux, which is 0.04 Webers.
Determine the final magnetic flux: phi_final = 0.04 Weber.
Calculate the change in magnetic flux: Delta phi = phi_final - phi = 0.04 - 0.04 = 0 Weber.
Since the magnetic flux does not change, the change in magnetic flux is 0 Webers.
The final magnetic flux is 0.04 Webers.
The final magnetic flux Wb is 0.04 Webers.
The magnetic flux changes by 0.04 Webers.
